meanings.definition: Generous in giving money or help to those in need.
meanings.sent1: She made a charitable donation to the local food bank.
meanings.sent2: The charitable organization provided aid to the homeless during the winter.
meanings.sent3: The charitable act of giving warm blankets to penguins made them very happy.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as warm and charitable as a ray of sunshine on a cold day.
meanings.sent5: The image of the kind old man handing out food was a truly charitable sight.

meanings.definition: Kind and forgiving in judging others.
meanings.sent1: He always had a charitable view of people's mistakes.
meanings.sent2: Being charitable towards others can lead to stronger relationships.
meanings.sent3: The charitable way she overlooked his forgetfulness was endearing.
meanings.sent4: Her forgiving nature was as charitable as a gentle breeze on a hot day.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's patient and charitable attitude helped the students learn effectively.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the assistance of those in need.
meanings.sent1: The charitable efforts of the community helped rebuild the school after the fire.
meanings.sent2: She dedicated her life to charitable work for the less fortunate.
meanings.sent3: The charitable spirit of the town was evident in their quick response to disasters.
meanings.sent4: The bond formed through charitable actions was stronger than any material possession.
meanings.sent5: The charitable heart of the nurse shone brightly in her care for the sick.
